name: Nuke Arsenal
problem: Terminal commands get lost in shell history - no context, no notes, no way to search by intent. Constantly forgetting commands across macOS, Docker, Node, Angular, project-specific tools.
solution: Native desktop app (GUI-only, no CLI) with commands grouped by tool. NavRail navigation, search by description, sync via git/iCloud.
benefits: Find commands by what they do, not exact syntax
Organize by tool: Docker, macOS, Node, Angular, etc.
Add notes explaining why/when to use a command
Sync across machines via git repo or iCloud
Instant access - just run 'arsenal' and window opens
philosophy: Single JSON file - flat and simple
Groups as pages - NavRail navigation like nuke-commander
Your terminal knowledge, persisted and synced

folders.cmd/arsenal/: Wails app entry point - just opens window

dataModel.dataFile: commands.json (user chooses location: git repo, iCloud, or local)
